title: Manchester United select Kalidou Koulibaly and Declan Rice as priority summer transfer targets
text:
Rice has emerged as one of England’s top talents (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United have made Kalidou Koulibaly and Declan Rice their priority signings next summer, according to reports.

The decision has been made despite speculation about the future of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer reaching new heights this week after defeat to Newcastle in the Premier League.

Solskjaer is facing the sack if he cannot turn results around, but Goal claim United’s transfer plans are already in place ahead of the 2020/21 season.

Rice is the priority target in midfield. The West Ham star has established himself as one of the league’s elite operators and United have been tracking the 20-year-old for the last year.

Koulibaly could cost a small fortune (Picture: Getty)

West Ham are likely to demand a mammoth fee for Rice, who fits the criteria United are seeking in new signings as a young, British star.

United spent big on English duo Harry Maguire and Aaron Wan-Bissaka during the summer and are prepared to do the same with Rice next year.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But United’s most expensive buy next summer is sure to be Napoli’s Koulibaly, who is valued at over £90million by his club.

United are determined to head into the new campaign with a new midfielder and centre-back in their ranks.

Koulibaly has long been linked with a switch to Old Trafford and United see the 28-year-old as the ideal partner for Maguire.

United transfer plans will not be affected were Solskjaer to be axed (Picture: Getty)

United are keen to match Maguire with an elite centre-back and their transfer plans will not be affected by who is in charge at the club once the summer window arrives.

Liverpool travel to Manchester after the international break and the club are already fearing the worst when the league leaders come to Old Trafford.

Solskjaer could be relieved of his duties if United suffer a heavy defeat to Liverpool in their next game.
